alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 23 at 7:45PM CDT until September 23 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southern Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 830 PM CDT. * At 745 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Weleetka, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Henryetta... Morris... Weleetka... Dewar... Schulter... Grayson... Hoffman... Clearview... Stidham... Vivian... Lake Eufaula State Park... Pharoah... Hitchita... Bryant... Pierce... Eram... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 222 and 257. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
